Good Comments: Get on with the times. Ugly font, atrocious timing, mp4, shitty encode... The usual good stuff.
Great yellow font with black borders, that avoids blending into backgrounds like so many other fansubbers' subs do. And since when is Arial a "horrendous" font?
Good quality video, easy readable subs - probably the one for baching.
They have the best quality when it comes to translations IMO. Their encodes are also my favourite.
Subtitles are not ugly... and they're easier to read than the fancy fonts most other subbers use.

good job, xbox 360 compatible
I just wish they'd learn how to use mkv
For good quality:) Keep it up! :D
Cos' they are the best. Enough said.
They've done a good job for over 15 years.
Excellent subtitles.   Easy to read, good translation.
best choice in terms of speed and quality
its good. only concern is that the yellow colored font is too bright.

ugly yellow font, but the most accurate translations. their subs are more literal than the other fansubbers subbing this if it's something you care about. basically simple subs with good translations. it's all you really need.
Subs are neat, the colour of the subs are perfectly fine not sure why there's so much negativity.

The subtitles flows very good, they feel natural and are easy to read (not too long). Also their subtitles for OPs and EDs are not intrusive and let you enjoy the OPs and EDs (not like the ANBU version).
Great subs, get over the yellow you entitled millennials
Great, coherent translation with a nostalgic typesetting to reflect the feel of the anime.
Bad Comments: They are great... But the font... Oh god the font... The only reason why one wouldn't choose this group is that one problem, which continues to glare directly at you in it's yellow-ness.
It's one to use horrendous fonts and colors, and yet another to hardsub it onto a shitty encode. Negatives built upon negatives don't make a positive in fansubs, these newbs.
Ugly yellow font with a black border.
veteran group, so you can trust their translations

Probably the most accurate translations out of all the groups, they're a bit more literal on the meanings too though, the only thing that I can complain about is the ugly ass font, seriously, why use that yellow font CA?
Best subs for Cross Game. =] The font is awesome too.
Sublime translation, easy to read font and great quality all round. As per usual. the people at CA do an amazing job.

Most accurate translation as compared to Jade and MJN. I also like the fact that they translate the writings on the posters etc. What bothers me a little is their choice of font colour.. Seems like they've been keeping to this style since OokiFuri ^^;

Face it, retards - professional subs are minimal and don't get in the way of the show. If you want flashy fonts, karaoke, sub group name plastered over the OP, and all that weeaboo e-peen garbage, then go with a different group. If you perfection, downloa

The piss yellow font fits well in anime that obviously wants to go for a nostalgic classic feel. Encode is perfect. Translation is great, though using Senior instead of Senpai kind of sucks. Shouldn't mess with Japanese honorifics it's a cultural thing. T
shitty translation, dialogue doesn't flow well at all, encode sucks ass
I watched the central anime subbed version and I think it was great

Good Comments: They have the best LotGH subs of all the one's I've seen.
There were a few spelling mistakes here and there.  However, they did sub all 110 episodes, and the video quality is quite good.  Great job, Central Anime!
I dont know... I thought the subs looked serious which really fit the series. There werent many spelling errors for a 110 eps series, either.
Good subtitles. Really happy with what they've put into it. And no annoying karaoke everywhere.
Excellent translations that capture the complexity of the original concepts.
Really poor quality even for such an old anime, as well as several translation errors. Same with their other projects, AVOID CA unless you have no other alternative.
Theres slight image quality errors in the first 10 eps or so, but with it beeing the only decently subbed, and more importantly, complete version theres no way around CA to begin with
The video quality aint the best but the subtitles are very good and the story and conversations between characters is the best part of the anime.
The sub is good, perhaps a little quick, but it's the only english sub around.
Granted I've only seen two episodes so far, there have been several occasions where the translations were completely the opposite of what they said.
Decent encode, easy to read font. The DVD remasters they're releasing look good too.

Aside from the fact that it must have taken a gargantuan amount of effort to translated OVER 100 EPISODES of an anime that is 90% TALKING? :3 Well, the subs have few to no grammar errors, and LOGH is completely translated. What more could you want?
It's amazing to see so much dialogue properly translated with very little grammatical errors.  They're the fansub to go with, no question.
Well, in a sense they did a proper job - shitsubs for shitty anime.
There really aren't any alternatives. The font and color is ugly but I can deal with it. Their text slides by way too fast.
Wonderful effort from a great group.
They've done a great job with all matters related to LotGH
The only real subs for this show. All others are mere knock offs of Central Anime's subs.
Seemingly flawless subs. They appear to really consider connotative meanings of words and choose the best. Prepare a dictionary.
Bad Comments: Central Anime is the only group to give this series a proper translation. Much appreciation to these guys.
Ugly yellow font, but they subbed this entire magnificent series; what more could you want?
The effort placed into the series is more than commendable, if you're going to watch this, go with Central Anime and nothing else. They got the job done.
Nice subs, and they are the only who has complete this Masterpiece
Quality rips, well done subbing. A little slow, but that is because the quality is so excellent
Very good translation quality. Understandable English is used and most of the dialogue is either natural or fitting.
not pretty, but good video quality and great translation
Great job. Some mistakes like "light years" instead of "light seconds", and that kind of random stuff that you usually don't notice, but the rest is great.
because i wanna be different than others! nice subs, really good job
Although the are some minor grammatical errors, Central Anime did a great job.
Correct translationsThey take extra care to not have their subs obstruct the subtitles that are often presentThey host their own torrents
The pure fact that they subbed 110 episodes of this epic tale with million characters is AMAZING.
Excellent, quality translations. Great vocabulary and syntax that are quite suited to a work of this grandeur.
Great translation and HD video = perfect
Perfect, is what I'd like to say but the font and colours are relatively ugly.
Perfectly timed, and well coloured for easy reading.
This group did a great job in providing good subtitles for this series, without which this underrated series would probably remain unknown to many in the English-speaking world

straightforward with no dumb karaoke or stupid special effects.

exactly what subs should be.
Hmm... What I can say? I don't know, maybe that where is no equal for you guys. Thanks.
Well, in a sense, they did a right job: shitty subs for shitty show.

Good Comments: Almost no errors, and nobody can touch these guys for vocabulary.
Thanks again CA, for being the only ones subbing such a great series.
Perfect. What fansubs should be. No bullshit, no awful memes and in jokes, just great translation work.
Bad Comments: continues to be a standard-bearer for great fansubbing
Good translation of Legend of the Galactic Heroes, which contains complex dialouge.
Well, nothing new here - shitsubs for shitty anime.

decent job of getting the -- rather important for a sports anime -- dialogue across.

Good Comments: They provide good and consistent fansubs.
As their website is shit and scarywater isn't available (Which they describe as their top hosting for torrents), someone explain where the torrents are for this group.
2002 called, they want their piss yellow subtitles back.
Bad Comments: They're the only group releasing subs. However, they still do the DVD-style every other episode English/Romaji for OP/ED lyrics, and yellow subs...
Awesome work as usual. They don't use scarywater anymore. They are on nyaatorrents. Read their forums. Google works too. Plus they've updated their links just recently

"Some people like the yellow, it's not a valid criticism."
What? Going by that logic nothing in the world should be criticized because there's always going to be one person who likes it. But anyway, I personally don't have a problem with the yellow. The o
Really... gonna downvote for yellow subtitles? I downvote the attitude of that person. Some people like the yellow, it's not a valid criticism.

Good Comments: Although the translation isn't  nothing spacial, this is the only group doing this.
Bad Comments: Really solid except for them putting spaces in front of each "?" and "!". That shit annoys me to no end, but that's a personal issue.

Good Comments: Why fit 16:9 anime into a 4:3 box?
They actually did a 16:9 version recently, but had to pull it down when Funimation got the rights to all  of Initial D.
Bad Comments: Maybe they have 4:3 screens and don't care about widescreen users, just like people who disregard fullscreen users by encoding 4:3 anime in 16:9 boxes.

Good Comments: only gripe was that the video was in letterbox format :(
Great work on an old anime.

Bad Comments: Lots of translation errors, awkward phrasing and missing letters. Image quality quite poor as well but that cant be helped

Good Comments: Good effort, even if the translations take a lot of liberty with the meaning. You can tell they really love it, these subs were not made carelessly.
No idea what the moron means by lacking corresponding subtitle file. All the remastered episodes contained full scripts and fonts. He probably doesn't know about soft subs and how to turn them on.
Many of the files lacked their corresponding subtitle file.

Randomly doesn't translate some lines, spaces between punctuation, and occasional silliness (character gives a countdown in English, subs are in Japanese). Mostly fine, though, with no stuffy literal translations.
Bad Comments: Despite the praise, there are a few things they could have done better. Extremely spotty coverage of song lyrics, somewhat inflexible dialogue. Still the best subs out there.

Too bad their DVD version is only 400p instead of 480p. I'm sticking with the AonE-Menclave TV version and its fabulous karaoke.
Excellent translation. Timing is great. And they are going to do both the blu-ray and the DVD version.
Bad Comments: Matching their always top-quality subs with top quality Blu-Ray video.  As of now, the best group for this show.
No honorifics, no distracting flashy karaoke, professional quality translation, good video and audio quality.  What more could you ask for?

I liked the translation they did more then the dubbed English version

i though is was a good translation and easy to read

Good Comments: How come nobody complains about the exact same stylings CA used in LoGH and Macross 7, but here it's "retarded"?
Excellent quality subs, that even translate signs and or environmental objects.
Matroska or not, it's still hardsub. Can't get rid of the retarded vob-styling. Going with DB on this one, at least they know what "readability" means.
One of the fastest groups. They've also done Season 1, so I'm following them.
Good subs but they are a horrible yellow colour, and terrible font.
Great subs. They've been doing this for 18 years. Definitely not n00bs.

I really can't stand that ugly yellow font!
The subs are easy to read and easy on the eyes.
They're slow  but the subs are good (besides this horrible yellow font) and it's CA!
way better than DB, without karaoke though
I think this is best available quality. Plus they have subbed all Oofuri episodes.

FUCK YOU, YELLOW SUBS ARE CLASSIC
The quality of the videos were amazing
Bad Comments: good quality files, for such an old show. I also really like how when they said something in english, the subs would have it in japanese. smart choice.

bitrate quality proves the size of files, great audio quality and single japanese audio, no need for english audio, thats what i like most.

Good Comments: Slower releases, but we all know CA isn't a speed sub group. They did LOGH, so it's only natural that their translation for Tytania is incredibly well done, dialogue fits the characters, consistency, etc.
Bad Comments: Excellent quality. Not once has CA disappointed. Heibi and his hired translators are a true gift to the community.

Good Comments: Excellent Quality.  Episode notes are included in the ED.
Staff credits, notes, computer screens/planets translated, excellent work here.
Bonus: episodes notes providing a few interesting facts.
Bad Comments: Very professionally done.  Translation notes during Ending Credits are interesting.

Good Comments: Because they use basic looking subs with all of their works and it feels more like a true translation than pretty subs.
